ownedComment.body: An agreed commitment to perform actions that meet obligations under an agreement
A request to do something.
An instruction to do something expressed in an amount of money.

A planned or performed action in the context of concluding or fulfilling an agreement.
Act to do something.

A party represents an autonomous entity in which a bank has a business interest. It has a legal definition and identity. A party is a Person, Organization, (a proposed definition for BIAN BOM adapted from BIAN Party Working Group)
- Entity involved in an activity. (ISO20022)
A specific role of a specific Party in the specific relationship.
A specific role of a specific Party in the specific relationship.
Restriction on capability or operations allowed. (ISO20022)

to do: definitie opzoeken
A statement of account is a detailed report of the contents of an account. (AccountingTool)

A unit of an organisation that does not have legal standing outside the organisation.
A logical element or segment of a company (such as accounting, production, marketing) representing a specific business function, and a definite place on the organizational chart, under the domain of a manager. Also called department, division, or a functional area. (Business Dictionary)
Read more: http://www.businessdictionary.com/definition/business-unit.html

A measuring state on which movements in value or amounts of assets, rights and obligations are registered.
Comment: It is a bookkeeping instrument holding the amount or value of something by registering the movements in plus and min when events happen which have an impact on the position. The term "account" is usually associated to an accounting or bookkeeping concept to hold the financial or stock state of a business concept. An account will typically group the debit and credit entries for a specific aspect of the business resulting from transactions, Often accounts are represented as a T-account which is a visual aid used to depict an account. Above the top portion of the T would be the account title. On the left-side of the base of the T would be any debit amounts; on the right-side would be the credit amounts. A commonly used bookkeeping method is the double-entry method. This means that every transaction has at least 2 movements. If a customer pays 100 € in cash, there is a decrease in the amount that the customer owes to the company (the customer position is decreased) an increase in the amount that the company has in cash (the cash position is increased)
An account can be assigning to one or more ledgers. A ledger is a group of accounts for a certain purpose. If there is need for multiple ledgers because of multiple purpose, an account can perfectly well assigned to multiple ledgers. When Ledgers are in real physical books, this is not possible. When ledgers are digital, accounts can be grouped into multiple groups at the same time. This practice is very rarely taught into courses for accounting, but in digital accounting, it is common practice.
Examples: stock account of a shop, cash register, bank account, financial accounting account, customer account, supplier account, ... Bank Account BE12 1234 5678 9012: is an individual banking account Accounts Payable, is a collective account keeping the balance of the amounts to pay by the organisation to its suppliers. The balance is the result of the financial movements related to suppliers. This account is managed usually in a General Ledger Supplier Account X, is an individual account keeping the balance of the amounts to pay by the organisation to an individual supplier. The balance is the result of the financial movements related to an individual supplier. This account is managed usually in a sub-ledger. Stock Account x, is an individual account keeping the balance of the amounts in stock of a specific good. A payment service to take fund out of an account.
The involvement (role) of an instance of a party in an instance of an account.

A planned or performed action in the context of concluding or fulfilling an agreement.
Act to do something.

Entry means Posting to an account that results in an increase or decrease to a balance. (ISO20022)
An entry posted/booked in the account.
The counted state (e.g., the amount of money, the value, the number) of something - It is the sum of entries - It is the derived attribute - It is an information object

A party represents an autonomous entity in which a bank has a business interest. It has a legal definition and identity. A party is a Person, Organization, (a proposed definition for BIAN BOM adapted from BIAN Party Working Group)
- Entity involved in an activity. (ISO20022)
The position of account at the certain point of time.
Jurisdiction that will be assigned in case of legal dispute.
The purpose or usage of location in relationship to the associated object like the mailing address for letters or URL for email address.
A specific role of a specific Party in the location.
The definition of an addressable space/position both in real and virtual environments with associated uses and entitlements
A value of Location Type expressing the place where an object can be found.
Nation with its own government. ISO20022

A Classification Hierarchy that distinguishes between locations according to specified viewpoint. Typical viewpoints are · geographical areas · political areas - countries, cities, ... · economical areas · business purposes such as sales areas · juridical areas · monetary areas · ... Often the location is used as an address to refer to the position of something. In this case Location Type can also be viewed from the perspective of "address type" such as Postal Address, or GPS-coordinates, etc.
A value of Location Type expressing that a location is an area where a legal authority has Jurisdiction.

A party represents an autonomous entity in which a bank has a business interest. It has a legal definition and identity. A party is a Person, Organization, (a proposed definition for BIAN BOM adapted from BIAN Party Working Group)
- Entity involved in an activity. (ISO20022)
A value of DocumentType expressing that the Document is a Title
The definition of an addressable space/position both in real and virtual environments with associated uses and entitlements
The rendering of a document to a medium and the transmission of the rendering via a communication channel.
A value of DocumentType expressing that the Document is a Share
A specific party who plays a specific role in the document.
A Classification Hierarchy that distinguishes between Documents according to the nature of the Information represented.
A specific role of a specific Party in the specific relationship.
A value of DocumentType expressing that the Document is a Certificate

Something tangible that records something, such as a recording or a photograph, or a writing that can be used to furnish evidence or information (FIBO)
Definition: A physical or digital representation of something meaningful to the audience.
Comment: 1.Technical: Manuals, instructions, tutorials, procedures, specifications, etc., that accompany a piece of equipment or software, and provide guidance for its proper use and maintenance. 2.Trading: Preparation of a set of commercial and financial documents that record or support a business transaction. International trade documentations include air waybill, bill of exchange, bill of lading, certificate of inspection, certificate of insurance, certificate of origin, commercial invoice, and consular invoice.
Read more: http://www.businessdictionary.com/definition/documentation.html#ixzz3EQGRGC4W
A value of DocumentType expressing that the Document is a Contract
A service for Verification, Amendment, Update, Archiving of document.
Specifies the location of document.
A package of services and goods, accompanied by term and condition which is offered as a whole to (internal or external) customers.
A request to do something.
An identifier that allows to uniquely refer to an instance of an Instruction.

Classification Value classifying the instruction according to the "type of action" to be applied to a subject matter.
examples: payment instruction, withdrawal instruction, blocking instruction, accounting instruction, sending instruction, purchase instruction blocked deposit, a blocked securities portfolio, pawn, etc.

An event related to the behaviour performed by an actor.
Comment: An actor can be a party or a machine An action Includes various types of requests, orders and financial transactions. Includes responses where appropriate. An action is an event which means that the concept describes the result of acting.
A specific role of a specific Party in the specific relationship.
structure/make-up of an organizational entity
A record of events/entries.
Posting events to the log.

A Classification Hierarchy that distinguishes between locations according to specified viewpoint. Typical viewpoints are · geographical areas · political areas - countries, cities, ... · economical areas · business purposes such as sales areas · juridical areas · monetary areas · ... Often the location is used as an address to refer to the position of something. In this case Location Type can also be viewed from the perspective of "address type" such as Postal Address, or GPS-coordinates, etc.
A Classification Hierarchy that distinguishes between Documents according to the nature of the Information represented.

A contract that gives rise to a financial asset of one entity and a financial liability or equity instrument of another entity. (IFRS) https://www.iasplus.com/en/standards/ias/ias32#:~:text=Key%20definitions%20%5BIAS%2032.11%5D,equity%20instrument%20of%20another%20entity
Financial instruments are financial contracts of different nature made between institutional units. These comprise the full range of financial claims and liabilities between institutional units, including contingent liabilities like guarantees, commitments, etc. (ISO 10962)

A planned or performed action in the context of concluding or fulfilling an agreement.
Act to do something.
An identifier that allows to uniquely refer to an instance of a transaction.

The Date that the transaction has occurred or is planned to occur. A characteristic of transaction which refers to the LifecycleDate of transaction (e.g., initiated date, executed date, fulfillment date).
Specifies the category of Transaction like payment transaction, accounting transaction, financial Transaction, banking transaction, etc.
A detailed explanation or commentary of transaction.
A characteristic of transaction which refers to the LifecycleStatus of transaction (e.g., initiated, executed, confirmed, cancelled, etc.)
The name of transaction.

Something tangible that records something, such as a recording or a photograph, or a writing that can be used to furnish evidence or information (FIBO)
Definition: A physical or digital representation of something meaningful to the audience.
Comment: 1.Technical: Manuals, instructions, tutorials, procedures, specifications, etc., that accompany a piece of equipment or software, and provide guidance for its proper use and maintenance. 2.Trading: Preparation of a set of commercial and financial documents that record or support a business transaction. International trade documentations include air waybill, bill of exchange, bill of lading, certificate of inspection, certificate of insurance, certificate of origin, commercial invoice, and consular invoice.
Read more: http://www.businessdictionary.com/definition/documentation.html#ixzz3EQGRGC4W
An identifier that allows to uniquely refer to an instance of a Document.
Specifies the type of the document, for example commercial invoice. (ISO20022)
Status of the document (e.g. delivered, paid, etc.). ISO20022
Specifies the function of the document. (ISO20022)
A transaction that changes the financial position (the status of the finances) of involved party.
The definition of an addressable space/position both in real and virtual environments with associated uses and entitlements
A description of the property, particularly if it has landmark characteristics.
Key dates associated with the directory entry (e.g. open date, refresh date).
The tracked status (e.g. under construction or repair, inhabited, vacant).
Type of location (e.g. building, point of interest, virtual location/device).
The planning or zoning status (e.g. residential, commercial, industrial).
The general purpose and neighborhood of the property (e.g. residential, industrial, commercial).
The construction approach for a property at the location (e.g. era and architecture as might be used in valuation).
The type of occupancy (e.g. residency, business, retail, entertainment).
The estimated (book) value of the property at the location - rental and purchase as appropriate.
An indication of the size or scale of the property where appropriate (e.g. 4 bedroom, 600 seat auditorium, 40 cover restaurant).

A measuring state on which movements in value or amounts of assets, rights and obligations are registered.
Comment: It is a bookkeeping instrument holding the amount or value of something by registering the movements in plus and min when events happen which have an impact on the position. The term "account" is usually associated to an accounting or bookkeeping concept to hold the financial or stock state of a business concept. An account will typically group the debit and credit entries for a specific aspect of the business resulting from transactions, Often accounts are represented as a T-account which is a visual aid used to depict an account. Above the top portion of the T would be the account title. On the left-side of the base of the T would be any debit amounts; on the right-side would be the credit amounts. A commonly used bookkeeping method is the double-entry method. This means that every transaction has at least 2 movements. If a customer pays 100 € in cash, there is a decrease in the amount that the customer owes to the company (the customer position is decreased) an increase in the amount that the company has in cash (the cash position is increased)
An account can be assigning to one or more ledgers. A ledger is a group of accounts for a certain purpose. If there is need for multiple ledgers because of multiple purpose, an account can perfectly well assigned to multiple ledgers. When Ledgers are in real physical books, this is not possible. When ledgers are digital, accounts can be grouped into multiple groups at the same time. This practice is very rarely taught into courses for accounting, but in digital accounting, it is common practice.
Examples: stock account of a shop, cash register, bank account, financial accounting account, customer account, supplier account, ... Bank Account BE12 1234 5678 9012: is an individual banking account Accounts Payable, is a collective account keeping the balance of the amounts to pay by the organisation to its suppliers. The balance is the result of the financial movements related to suppliers. This account is managed usually in a General Ledger Supplier Account X, is an individual account keeping the balance of the amounts to pay by the organisation to an individual supplier. The balance is the result of the financial movements related to an individual supplier. This account is managed usually in a sub-ledger. Stock Account x, is an individual account keeping the balance of the amounts in stock of a specific good. A payment service to take fund out of an account.
A characteristic of account which refers to the LifecycleStatus of account like opened, closed, blocked, etc.
The identifier of account like Account Number.
A characteristic of account which refers to LifecycleDate of account (e.g., ClosingDate, OpeningDate, LiveDate, etc.)
Specifies the category of account like payment account, loan account, cash account, securities account, etc.

The state of the obligations managed on the account, the result of all entries on the account.
Numerical representation of the net increases and decreases in an account at a specific point in time. (ISO20022)
Banking: Amount available in an account for withdrawal or use. Read more: http://www.businessdictionary.com/definition/balance.html
Bookkeeping: Difference between the debit and credit sides of an account. Read more: http://www.businessdictionary.com/definition/balance.html
A detailed explanation or commentary of account.
Something that happens, has happened, can happen or is planned to happen.

Entry means Posting to an account that results in an increase or decrease to a balance. (ISO20022)
An entry posted/booked in the account.

The amount of funds entered on the account
has a plus or minus sign
The currency in which the AccountEntryAmount is expressed
Specified a document that is assigned to a specific transaction.
An agreed commitment to perform actions that meet obligations under an agreement
A request to do something.
An instruction to do something expressed in an amount of money.

A planned or performed action in the context of concluding or fulfilling an agreement.
Act to do something.

A party represents an autonomous entity in which a bank has a business interest. It has a legal definition and identity. A party is a Person, Organization, (a proposed definition for BIAN BOM adapted from BIAN Party Working Group)
- Entity involved in an activity. (ISO20022)
A specific role of a specific Party in the specific relationship.
Instruction to pay an amount of money to an ultimate beneficiary, on behalf of an originator. (ISO20022)
A request to do something.
Party who plays a specific role in a specific payment instruction.

An act, initiated by the payer or payee, of placing, transferring or withdrawing funds, irrespective of any underlying obligations between the payer and payee (a proposed definition for BIAN BOM adapted from PSD)
Instruction to execute a payment from a payer to a payee
Transfer of money between two parties and/or accounts
An instruction to do something expressed in an amount of money.
An arrangement which specifies the promise to offer the payment service, accompanied by the payment modalities.
Account where the funds are to be credited/debited for a payment instruction.
Directions on how the selected payment mechanism would be used; E.g. what service level (instant payment or not...), e.g. what intermediate correspondents should be used...

A measuring state on which movements in value or amounts of assets, rights and obligations are registered.
Comment: It is a bookkeeping instrument holding the amount or value of something by registering the movements in plus and min when events happen which have an impact on the position. The term "account" is usually associated to an accounting or bookkeeping concept to hold the financial or stock state of a business concept. An account will typically group the debit and credit entries for a specific aspect of the business resulting from transactions, Often accounts are represented as a T-account which is a visual aid used to depict an account. Above the top portion of the T would be the account title. On the left-side of the base of the T would be any debit amounts; on the right-side would be the credit amounts. A commonly used bookkeeping method is the double-entry method. This means that every transaction has at least 2 movements. If a customer pays 100 € in cash, there is a decrease in the amount that the customer owes to the company (the customer position is decreased) an increase in the amount that the company has in cash (the cash position is increased)
An account can be assigning to one or more ledgers. A ledger is a group of accounts for a certain purpose. If there is need for multiple ledgers because of multiple purpose, an account can perfectly well assigned to multiple ledgers. When Ledgers are in real physical books, this is not possible. When ledgers are digital, accounts can be grouped into multiple groups at the same time. This practice is very rarely taught into courses for accounting, but in digital accounting, it is common practice.
Examples: stock account of a shop, cash register, bank account, financial accounting account, customer account, supplier account, ... Bank Account BE12 1234 5678 9012: is an individual banking account Accounts Payable, is a collective account keeping the balance of the amounts to pay by the organisation to its suppliers. The balance is the result of the financial movements related to suppliers. This account is managed usually in a General Ledger Supplier Account X, is an individual account keeping the balance of the amounts to pay by the organisation to an individual supplier. The balance is the result of the financial movements related to an individual supplier. This account is managed usually in a sub-ledger. Stock Account x, is an individual account keeping the balance of the amounts in stock of a specific good. A payment service to take fund out of an account.
The role of an account in a payment instruction
The specific role that a specific party has in a specific payment instruction
The role of an account in a transaction
The meaning of a time indication for an object; E.g. opening data of an account, signing date of an agreement... birth date of a person.
A point in time. Can be a period, a date or a more detailed time indication.
Transfer of money between two parties and/or accounts
Money Transfer instruction given to a Payment Service Provider
Instruction to execute a payment from a payer to a payee
A specific role of a specific Party in the specific relationship.
Restriction on capability or operations allowed. (ISO20022)

A party represents an autonomous entity in which a bank has a business interest. It has a legal definition and identity. A party is a Person, Organization, (a proposed definition for BIAN BOM adapted from BIAN Party Working Group)
- Entity involved in an activity. (ISO20022)
The position of account at the certain point of time.
An agreement that outlines the terms and conditions of the relationship between the two or more parties. An agreement has arrangements which are the cause of the relationship.
Human entity, as distinguished from a corporate entity (which is sometimes referred to as an 'artificial person'). ISO20022
A specific role of a specific Party in the specific relationship.
A place to locate a party.
structure/make-up of an organizational entity
Number, physical or virtual address, used for communication.
The definition of an addressable space/position both in real and virtual environments with associated uses and entitlements

A party represents an autonomous entity in which a bank has a business interest. It has a legal definition and identity. A party is a Person, Organization, (a proposed definition for BIAN BOM adapted from BIAN Party Working Group)
- Entity involved in an activity. (ISO20022)

A written authorization that transfers specific rights from a party to another party.
Document that transfers specific rights from a party to another party. ISO20022

A relationship between two or more parties; the parties involved are specified in terms of the roles they play in the relationship.
A Party Relationship is a connection between an instance of a Party and two or more instances of associated objects in the relationship.

Something tangible that records something, such as a recording or a photograph, or a writing that can be used to furnish evidence or information (FIBO)
Definition: A physical or digital representation of something meaningful to the audience.
Comment: 1.Technical: Manuals, instructions, tutorials, procedures, specifications, etc., that accompany a piece of equipment or software, and provide guidance for its proper use and maintenance. 2.Trading: Preparation of a set of commercial and financial documents that record or support a business transaction. International trade documentations include air waybill, bill of exchange, bill of lading, certificate of inspection, certificate of insurance, certificate of origin, commercial invoice, and consular invoice.
Read more: http://www.businessdictionary.com/definition/documentation.html#ixzz3EQGRGC4W

A certification issued for a party.
An issued document to certify a party.
A set of information giving a description of a person or organization.
A transaction that changes the financial position (the status of the finances) of involved party.

An act, initiated by the payer or payee, of placing, transferring or withdrawing funds, irrespective of any underlying obligations between the payer and payee (a proposed definition for BIAN BOM adapted from PSD)
An identifier that allows to uniquely refer to a Payment Transaction.
The payment mechanism the bank decides to use in the transaction to execute a payment instruction
A party role which is involved in the payment transaction.
The role that a party plays in a payment transaction.
Transfer of money between two parties and/or accounts
The amount of money transferred from the source to the target.
The currency of the money transfer amount
The account the money is transferred from.
The account the money is transferred to.
The method used to transfer money; Can be a payment network but also something physical.
The date on which the money is considerd to have left/have arrived become active can be used /strats to starts is considerd to be
Instruction to pay an amount of money to an ultimate beneficiary, on behalf of an originator. (ISO20022)
A classification of an instance of a payment instruction as an inbound or outbound payment.

Classification of a payment instruction according to the arrangement type that made it possible/generated it
There are several ways a payment instruction can be created - as a consequence of the fulfillment of an arrangement ("a "xxx-FulfillmentEvent" (a standing order instruction is also the fulfillment of an arrangement) - as an instruction given by a customer (made possible by a payment service arrangement), e.g. a credit transfer, a card payment, a withdrawal, a deposit, a direct debit instruction.
The payment system requested to be used in a payment instruction.
Type of critical dates of a payment transaction executed by the payment order like RequestedExecutionDate.
An instruction to do something expressed in an amount of money.
Instruction to execute a payment from a payer to a payee

A Classification Hierarchy that distinguishes between Party Roles according to the associated object type.
Associated object types are for example location (PartyLocation), agreement (Agreement Involvement) , Product (Product Involvement); etc.

An arrangement into which is promised to deliver a specific service.
Comment: Most service arrangements are instantiations of Product Services
An agreed commitment to perform actions that meet obligations under an agreement
An arrangement defining the applicable features for a loan account agreement.
An arrangement defining the applicable features for a Corporate Deposit Agreement.

An arrangement defining the applicable features for a savings account agreement.
The arrangement type is one of those possible/mandatory for the sale of a savings account product. The actual arrangements are a selection of those offered under the savings account product.

A formal or informal common understanding between two or more (legal competent) parties concerning one or more subject matters expressed in a set of arrangements, terms and conditions. (adapted from Legal System and FIBO)

An agreement that authorises a party (holding party) to act on behalf of a principal party.
Authorisation given by an issuing party to a holder party to act on the issuer's behalf. (ISO20022)
Written authorization and/or command by a person, group, or organization (the 'mandator') to another (the 'mandatary') to take a certain course of action. (Business Dictionary)
A specific role of a specific Party in the specific relationship.
Exchange rate used in the payment transaction. (ISO20022)
Currency of the amount to be transferred which may be different from the currency of the debtor's account. (ISO20022)

- Entity involved in an activity. (ISO20022)
Name by which a party is known and which is usually used to identify that party. (ISO20022)
Specifies the type of party in different business contexts. (ISO20022)
